Content: We've at least ironed out all the critical bugs. We'll have two months to figure out notary change mechanism.(the political side of it, tech side is ready)

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yeah I guess we can do that... However I am not really fully avalibe for a few days, and I assume being this time of the year, lots of others are not either. We should make sure the cluster is working, even make new chains for MoMoM test, to make 100% sure these chains are not causing some issues... LOTs of code was changed on these chains, its amazing they haven't died...

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Agreed, want to set a date for the stress test?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: need to talk about prize money, I'll PM. What's the best metric to pick a winner you think?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: just register an address then we'll count how many migrates that address had?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think breaking it should be the goal... anyone who manages to make it break and can reproduce it ? Or yeah, if it does not break, the person with the most migrates wins should be ok too.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: We have that ~17k that was left in contracts we could use. Can put up some KMD myself as well

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I used a single address to manage liek 25,000 mirates on CFEK* chains ... with 0 fails that I know of... but there wre times the chains stalled, and my VM crashed out, stuffing the data up.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: So we do need another formal test, the chains should no longer break and stall with all the changes to the staker I made.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: The limit we're going to put on weekly bounties... 1% sound about right to you?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: 1% of emissions for that week

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yeah... Also I think that notaries should be more profitable than staking... I thaught about this a lot... and if they are not... then the inventive to notarise isnt there and they will just stake.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: why not both?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Not sure you can stake on notary, maybe you can now that staking no longer hard locks the daemon... but its untested.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: it's just a different way of earning coins, nothing stopping someone from doing both

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Also with the new splitfund, maybe it will work, as it no longer should need a very specific type of utxo to split.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: you're suggesting we up the 10%?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Its hard, but I think 10% over 20  nodes is a little low...

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Set a deadline for these changes to be decided, throw it into production and tweak as needed?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: maybe 20% ... and less PoW I'm not really sure how it best should be done, but notary should really be the highest earner, as its the most important to the entire system

Author: Alright#0419
Content: needs to be set in stone before that deadline

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: PoW is not really super important, apart form distribution of coins

Author: Alright#0419
Content: phase out pow then?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: gradually change the % to go to notaries instead?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Need it at least at the start so ppl can get coins, to be a notary or to stake

Author: Alright#0419
Content: that's what most 100% POS coins do anyway

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: But that said, there is no way to change % based on heights that exists. We would ahve to make it, causing more delays.4

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Unless we have 1 more set of chains, and hardfork and airdrop.

Content: will ac_era work?

Content: Dont think so... thats only for coin emmission...

Content: Guess you will need to try it ...
